SEARCH
Package librarySE.repo

Interface BorrowRecordRepository

All Known Implementing Classes:
FileBorrowRecordRepository
public interface BorrowRecordRepository
Defines the contract for persistence operations related to BorrowRecord.

This interface abstracts how borrowing records are stored and retrieved from persistent storage (such as JSON files or databases).

Typical implementations include:

  • FileBorrowRecordRepository – stores borrow records in a JSON file.
  • DatabaseBorrowRecordRepository – stores borrow records in a database (future expansion).

Responsibilities:

  • Load all existing borrow records from storage.
  • Persist updates after borrowing, returning, or fine application.

Usage Example:


 BorrowRecordRepository repo = new FileBorrowRecordRepository();
 List<BorrowRecord> records = repo.loadAll();

 // Add a new borrowing record
 records.add(new BorrowRecord(user, item, fineStrategy, LocalDate.now()));
 repo.saveAll(records);
Author:
Eman

  • Method Details

    • loadAll

      List<BorrowRecord> loadAll()
      Loads all BorrowRecord entries from persistent storage.
      Returns:
      a list of all borrow records; never null, but may be empty

    • saveAll

      void saveAll(List<BorrowRecord> records)
      Saves the given list of BorrowRecord objects to persistent storage.

      This method is typically called after any borrowing or returning action.

      Parameters:
      records - the list of borrow records to save; must not be null
